sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular event risk, Reduction: 80 mg ORALLY once daily
  • Hypertension: initial, 40 mg ORALLY once daily; dose range, 20 to 80 mg ORALLY once daily

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• hepatic impairment, biliary obstruction: provide close monitoring
  • volume depletion, dialysis patients: provide close monitoring for blood pressure

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Cardiovascular event risk, Reduction
  • Hypertension
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Atrial fibrillation, Recurrence; Prophylaxis - Hypertension
  • Kidney disease
  • Left ventricular hypertrophy
  • Recurrent atrial fibrillation; Prophylaxis

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Oral (Tablet)
Drugs with direct action on the renin-angiotensin system can cause injury or death to the developing fetus. Stop therapy as soon as possible when pregnancy is detected.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• Concomitant aliskiren use in patients with diabetes
  • Hypersensitivity to telmisartan or any other component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Black Box Warning:
  • -- Avoid use in pregnant women; fetal and neonatal injury, including fatalities, have occurred; discontinue therapy as soon as possible when pregnancy is detected
  • Cardiovascular:
  • -- Patients with volume or salt depletion (eg, receiving high doses of diuretics) have an increased risk of symptomatic hypotension; monitoring required and dose adjustment necessary unless condition is corrected prior to initiation
  • -- Patients with severe congestive heart failure; changes in renal function, including oliguria, progressive azotemia, acute renal failure, or death have been reported
  • Endocrine and Metabolic:
  • -- Hyperkalemia may occur; increased risk with advanced renal impairment, heart failure, or patients on renal replacement therapy, potassium-sparing diuretics, potassium supplements, or potassium-containing salt substitutes; monitoring recommended
  • Hepatic:
  • -- Patients with hepatic impairment or biliary obstructive disorder may experience reduced clearance; dose adjustment necessary
  • Renal:
  • -- Patients on dialysis have an increased risk of orthostatic hypotension; monitoring recommended
  • -- Patients with renal dysfunction; changes in renal function, including oliguria, progressive azotemia, acute renal failure, or death have been reported; monitoring recommended
  • -- Patients whose renal function may depend on renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system activity; changes in renal function, including oliguria, progressive azotemia, acute renal failure, or death have been reported
  • -- Patients with unilateral or bilateral renal artery stenosis may experience increased serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen levels
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- Avoid concomitant use of angiotensin-receptor blockers, ACE inhibitors, or aliskiren; risk of hypotension, hyperkalemia, and renal function changes (eg, acute renal failure) increased; monitoring recommended
  • -- Avoid concomitant use of aliskiren in patients with renal impairment (GFR less than 60 mL/min/1.73 m(2))
  • -- Concomitant use with ramipril is not recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono:
• Systemic: Telmisartan is a nonpeptide angiotensin II antagonist that selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to the AT 1 receptors in vascular smooth muscle and the adrenal gland . In the renin-angiotensin system, angiotensin I is converted by angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) to form angiotensin II . Angiotensin II stimulates the adrenal cortex to synthesize and secrete aldosterone, which decreases the excretion of sodium and increases the excretion of potassium . Angiotensin II also acts as a vasoconstrictor in vascular smooth muscle . By blocking the binding of angiotensin II to the AT 1 receptors, telmisartan causes vasodilation and decreases the effects of aldosterone . The negative feedback regulation of angiotensin II on renin secretion also is inhibited, resulting in a rise in plasma renin concentrations and a consequent rise in angiotensin II plasma concentrations; however, these effects do not counteract the blood pressure-lowering effect that occurs .
  • Telmisartan may have an inhibitory effect on cytochrome P450 2C19 isozyme and may affect the metabolism of medications that are metabolized by this enzyme .

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • may be administered with or without food
  • tablets should not be removed from blisters until immediately before administration

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Oral Tablet: 20 MG, 40 MG, 80 MG
  • Micardis
    Oral Tablet: 20 MG, 40 MG, 80 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should avoid activities requiring coordination until drug effects are realized, as this medicine may cause dizziness.
  • Advise patient to rise slowly from sitting/lying position as drug may cause orthostatic hypotension.
  • This drug may cause asthenia, cough, and fatigue.
  • Advise patient against sudden discontinuation of drug.
